#  What science can do

* * *

* * *

## We are transforming the future of healthcare by unlocking the power of what
science can do, for people, society and planet.

* * *

Discover more about our company

* * *

* * *

* * *

## Trending science story

Translational science: Decoding cancer's secrets

What science can do stories

##  Featured articles

Putting Health at the Heart of COP28

Articles

Addressing the deeply inequitable human toll of noncommunicable diseases

Articles

Keep up to date with the latest media articles

* * *

> Kidney disease is not just one disease process - the patient population and
> the underlying biology is highly heterogenous. Our research approach is to
> target the different underlying molecular causes of disease, classifying
> patients more accurately, and identifying new biomarkers and disease targets
>
> Martin Cowie, Interim Senior Vice President Late-Stage Development,
> Cardiovascular, Renal and Metabolism (CVRM), BioPharmaceuticals R&D,
> AstraZeneca

Learn more about our research to target proteinuria for chronic kidney disease

Discover how we champion inclusion and diversity at AstraZeneca

We have

167

projects in our pipeline

View pipeline

Explore our precision medicine approach

The Discovery Centre in Cambridge (UK) is one of our three global science
centres

Explore all our science centres

##  Our Sustainability ambition

Corporate Press Release

Imfinzi plus transarterial chemoembolisation (TACE) and bevacizumab reduced
the risk of disease progression or death by 23% vs. TACE in liver cancer
eligible for embolisation

19 January 2024

Corporate Press Release

Voydeya (danicopan) granted first-ever regulatory approval in Japan for adults
with PNH to be used in combination with C5 inhibitor therapy

19 January 2024

worldwide business. Our country sites can be located in the AZ Network.
